ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The revelation of the Almighty, the Most Merciful
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: A revelation from the mighty, ever-merciful (God),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (and this Qur'an) is a revelation from the Most Mighty, the Most Compassionate
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: This is a revelation sent down from the Majestic and All-merciful
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: (The Qur’an is) Sent down by the Almighty, the Most Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Sent down by the Almighty, the Most Merciful,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: A revelation of the Mighty, the Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: the sending down of the All-mighty, the All-wise,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: A revelation of the Mighty, the Merciful,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: with a revelation sent down by the Mighty One, the Merciful,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: This is a revelation of the Mighty, the Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [It is a scripture] sent down gradually from the All-mighty, the All-merciful
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: It is a Revelation sent down by (Him), the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (This is) a Revelation sent down by the AllMighty, the Most Merciful,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The sending down of the Mighty, the Most Merciful
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The revelation of the Almighty, the Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [This is] a revelation of the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:5] A revelation from the Mighty, in His kingdom, the Merciful, to His creatures (tanzīla’l-‘azīzi’l-rahīm is the predicate of an implicit subject, namely, al-qur’ān),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (A revelation of the Mighty) He says: the Qur'an is the Word of the Mighty in His retribution against those who disbelieve in Him, (the Merciful) towards those who believe in Him,
